DOCNAME: CASE OF MEHMET ALİ ÇELİK v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is remanded in custody in ORG prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into police custody on suspicion of membership of ORG , an illegal organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE a single judge at ORG remanded him in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL other persons . The applicant was charged with attempting to undermine the constitutional order , an offence proscribed by LAW . According to the information in the case file , the proceedings against the applicant are still pending at first instance , which is now ORG , and the applicant remains in detention on remand .

CARDINAL . During the proceedings , the first - instance courts have examined the applicant ’s continued detention at the end of every hearing , either on their own motion or at the applicant ’s request . The courts ordered the applicant ’s continued detention , having regard to the nature of the offence , the state of evidence and the content of the file on each occasion .
